intro: Viola biflora subsp. biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered violet, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces clusters of violet-blue flowers with five petals, often in pairs, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
